title: Elementary English 206
headline: This free online English course explains grammar and describes famous landmarks to let you travel with confidence.
description: This English course provides the vocabulary needed for locating and describing famous landmarks. These words and phrases will help you to travel as you visit these places and converse with other tourists in English. Our grammar section explains how to use present tense verbs in the present simple and present continuous and examines 'future time' expressions. Sign up to improve your English skills and add valuable words to your repertoire.
courseDescription:
Many people dream of traveling the world. This course provides travel vocabulary, the names of famous landmarks, and their locations to enable you to converse in English, thus enriching your journey. The audio clips in this section improve your pronunciation and boost your confidence in speaking English.

The course's following two topics draw on this new vocabulary to help you practice and improve your grammar skills. Learn to combine the present simple and present continuous tense with 'future time' expressions to express future events. You will also learn to use 'when' statements to describe plans. We describe future intentions and predictions using 'be going to' and explore how to discuss the future with 'will.' 'Will' can also be used before the subject of a sentence to form questions.

Our final section takes all the grammar and vocabulary you learned in the previous topics to look at practical examples to reinforce your knowledge. You will read articles from travel magazines and answer questions about them. Your listening and writing skills will also be stretched until you become more proficient in English. English is a global language, so sign up for this course to learn how to speak to other travelers and local residents while you explore new horizons with your newfound skills.
